website_summaries.verdict: One of the most popular bamboo toothbrush sets available, this remarkable model is sure to impress.
pros: Toothbrushes are individually numbered to help family members keep track of their brush
One pack can last up to 1 year for an individual
Container made out of recycled materials
cons: Bristles can be hard even though they are advertised as soft nylon

customer_reviews.title: Great Brushes
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are really nice. They came individually packaged for easy storage. Getting used to the wood taste while brushing took a couple days, but wasn't overwhelming. Bristles are very soft and none have come out so far. Very pleased with the price - plastic toothbrushes cost much more in the store! If you found my review helpful, please click Yes below! :)
customer_reviews.author: madeline audreyTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money- cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Bristles fell out in less than a week. Wish I could return these but amazon won’t let me. Waste of money to get bristles stuck between your teeth
customer_reviews.author: P. Ann

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love them! The toothbrush feels comfortable in my mouth ...
customer_reviews.text: I have decided to start making more eco friendly choices when shopping so decided to try these bamboo toothbrushes. I absolutely love them! The toothbrush feels comfortable in my mouth and makes my teeth feel really clean. I was a little worried about how a bamboo toothbrush would feel in my mouth compared to a plastic one and though it does feel a little different, it really doesn't seem to make a difference. I will definitely be buying these toothbrushes again and am thinking of buying them for one of my sons as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ives Nee

customer_reviews.title: Bristles feel good, not too soft or hard
customer_reviews.text: Bristles feel good, not too soft or hard. Its a little bigger than the toothbrushes I used before so if you have a smaller mouth you might feel a little discomfort... but I love that these are biodegradable! will definitely repurchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: The pictures explain why I gave this product 1 star. After a month of using this toothbrush, I had to get rid of it. This product is waste of money.. not zero waste ... sorry for the comment but this is the truth. I don’t want people eat plastic while they brush their teeth
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning your sink faucet but not your teeth!
customer_reviews.text: I am really trying to be better at mak by my carbon footprint smaller but I cannot at the cost of my oral health. I’ve been using this tooth brush for a month now, why I used it that long I do not know, but it hurt very badly to brush my teeth. I have very good teeth and gums but this tooth brush made my gums bleed everyday. It came it a point where I was afraid to brush my teeth. This pack of four has now become my cleaning scrub brushes and work great at getting into small places. I guess that should say something about the roughness of the bristles
customer_reviews.author: MsS

customer_reviews.title: Eco- AND gum-friendly brush inspires me to go two full minutes
customer_reviews.text: For the longest time, my lazy/cheap self refused to buy anything beyond the basic offbrand toothbrushes once the lens my dentist gave me started to fall apart. Eventually, I graduated to a low-end electric one that I enjoyed. Sadly, that has left my gums damaged and sore after months of use. Enter this toothbrush, with a nice ergonomic handle and very soothing soft bristles. Aside from the eco-friendliness (they're apparently also compostable), they really do have a nice feeling on my gums. Almost like a massage, without exaggeration. Highly recommended, 10/10, would buy again if the pack ever failed me (it won't).
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a good alternative to plastic toothbrushes, and so I was excited to try this product. I should have tried one toothbrush first, but assumed I'd like the product, so I bought a four-pack, so that it would last me a year. While the packaging is eco-friendly, as well as the brush itself, the bristles aren't. Furthermore, the texture of the bamboo makes my mouth feel dry. The bristles a rigid, and between the shape of the brush and the bristles, I am unable to clean my teeth well. At least when I throw these out, I'll be making less of an economic impact.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like these because of how eco-friendly they are
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these because of how eco-friendly they are. The toothbrush handle tastes like a popsicle stick and when it rubs against my lips it left a burning sensation, like I had slivers in my lip. I gave it another shot and used it again the next day, but the same thing happened. Unfortunately I would not purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica DeAngelis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I like about these toothbrushes is that the handle is eco-friendly. The box states that the bristles are soft, however, they are worse than the hardest toothbrushes on the market. Btw, most places stopped selling hard toothbrushes, as they are detrimental to dental health and actually can cause damage to gum and tooth enamel. Very disappointing. I now have 4 (1 used and 3 unused) brushes for household cleaning chores. Wasted money, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Iceflower

customer_reviews.title: Need design improvement
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I could like these but they are soooo uncomfortable. The bristles are either too long that when I brush deeper in my mouth by my molars it is so uncomfortable and the wood hurts. Occasionally some of the bristles will fall out too. I found that they didn’t clean my teeth very good. I with they had medium instead of only soft bristles.
customer_reviews.author: julia huitron

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are fabulous! I can't speak highly enough about them. Perfect adult size tooth brush ... not too stiff not too soft. The handle fits nicely in your hands. So much nicer than plastic! I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Worth Trying
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous to get these toothbrushes because I was not sure if I would like them, but I also have been trying to create less trash/use less plastic generally so I decided to give it a go. Overall, I am pleased with this product. No complaints on how well it brushes my teeth, they feel just as clean as a regular toothbrush. I was worried about splintering, but after a few weeks of use, the first brush is still smooth. The brush head is a little larger than I'm used to so it can be a little harder to reach the teeth at the back of my mouth, but other than that I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: ninjajen

customer_reviews.title: 🥴
customer_reviews.text: It might be nice, eco friendly, and nice to the environment.... but that stupid brush is so wide it makes it difficult to brush my teeth. If it were a little less wide and thick it might be easier and not feel like a have a HUGE block of wood in my mouth. Plus, the house I rent is old as crap and holds moisture so this probably isn’t the best this to have. I mean.. it’s wood.. in a bathroom that stays moist..... ew.... no thank you to mold central.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer whitley

customer_reviews.title: Love the clean feel! Wish a smaller brush head size were available.
customer_reviews.text: Was very sceptical about using it the first time, but I was very keen on avoiding the use of plastic toothbrushes completely. After reading all the reviews I eventually went ahead and purchased this. After using this toothbrush for the first time, I realized that the bristles were very soft and didn’t need to be softened under hot running water before use. But the brush head seemed a little big and uncomfortable initially. However, I’ve gotten used to it now. The only suggestion I would give the manufacturer is to ALSO offer a brush head size slightly smaller than the one they have, for people with smaller mouths. I find it a little difficult to brush behind my wisdom teeth.
customer_reviews.author: KNeeli

customer_reviews.title: love these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids and I. We love the feel of the soft bristles and the beautiful wooden handle. They are numbered so that you always know which one is yours!
customer_reviews.author: Shoppermom

customer_reviews.title: Will Never Switch Back
customer_reviews.text: I’m extremely happy with this product. My primary reason for purchasing this product is it being eco-friendly and inexpensive. I love that there are four in the package, so that I don’t need to stock up anytime soon and can switch to a new one when needed. This is surprisingly a very effective toothbrush. I feel like I’m getting a great clean without irritating my gums and cramping my hand. The brush is lightweight and comfortable to hold and use. Will definitely purchase more when I run out!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Pappas

customer_reviews.title: YMMV, but it tastes weird in my mouth
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of a more eco-friendly toothbrush. This works fine for cleaning my teeth (though the bristles didn't last as long as I might have hoped), but I have had a difficult time getting used to the taste/sensation of the bamboo in my mouth. It feels like a popsicle stick. I've been using these for a couple months now, and I'm still not really used to it. That may just be me, though; it might not bother others the same way.
customer_reviews.author: P Maines

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea that this is about as green as ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what I expected. I like the idea that this is about as green as I can get with a toothbrush. Putting wood in my mouth takes a little getting used to. It is not unpleasant, just different. Since each brush is the same, I like the numbers to tell them apart. I probably will continue using them. Price is pretty well on the mark.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but stupid shipping packaging
customer_reviews.text: I love these toothbrushes, so this was a reorder. I buy them to avoid adding more plastic toothbrushes to landfills, and I actually like the feel of them in my hand better than plastic toothbrushes. And they come in a plastic free light cardboard box. But what did they ship in? A bubble wrap padded envelope! Like there's a concern about them breaking! I was so disappointed and felt like it was an epic fail on my part and theirs. Next time I'll order directly from the Wowe site and not Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Change The Box To Say These Are Organic!
customer_reviews.text: The bristles are nice and soft. They are gentle. They cradle the areas being brushed perfectly and get every area very clean. Easy to use. BPA free bristles. Which I like, because I’m sensitive to it. It’s nice to have four of these, so I can buy toothbrushes once and have enough for an entire year. I do wish it would say on the box that they are organic, because there is no indication of this anywhere on it. That’s annoying, since that was another reason I bought them, because they’re supposed to be organic.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Too soft
customer_reviews.text: The handle and head took a few sessions before my mouth got used to them. The main issue I had was that the bristles are WAY too soft. If you usually prefer medium bristles on the average toothbrush, DO NOT BUY. If you prefer soft bristles then just do not expect them to last the recommended 2-3 months to switch out, mine lasted about 2-3 WEEKS before the bristles were so flattened that it was no longer doing anything for my teeth. I usually buy medium bristle toothbrushes but did not realize that some wooden ones do come in medium and should have tried those instead.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsi

customer_reviews.title: Eco-Friendly? Yes.  A Great Toothbrush? Absolutely Yes.
customer_reviews.text: I am 62 years old and have used a lot of toothbrushes in my life. These have easily become my favorites. I like the environmental statement they make, but more significantly I think they are the perfect combination of bristle and reach. I use each brush about 10 days and relegate it to my workshop. If you think you are going to use one of these for a year you will probably be disappointed. However, if you factor in the cost of dental care changing these out with some frequency is cost effective. Amazon's subscription option makes it easy. Bottom line, this is one of the relatively few products I actually like enough to spend time reviewing.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrush is very sturdy and practical. My dentist recommended I use a flat type brush as opposed to the curved brush version they are selling now a days. Very comfortable and inexpensive. This box comes with 4 or 5 brushes. Being that most people change their brushes between 3 to 6 months, this pays out well and you contribute to the environment. Most important, not adding plastic to our lands.. We need to care for the planet and the future generations. Look at ours, we have to start NOW and use biodegradable products so we can enjoy our planet and clean it up.
customer_reviews.author: Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased other brands of bamboo toothbrushes and weren't completely satisfied. Either the bristles weren't as strong as a .
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased other brands of bamboo toothbrushes and weren't completely satisfied. Either the bristles weren't as strong as a regular toothbrush or the wood would get gross or even start to get little mold spots even after a couple days. This brand has been by far the best out of the bamboo toothbrushes that I have tried. The wood finish won't give you splinters and the bristles are nice and strong and will last for a bit until you change. This one box will get someone through a year without using so much plastic on a regular toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I JUST got this package in the mail. As soon as I showed my family what I ordered, they took all the toothbrushes from me so I ordered another one on the spot. First impressions, a great product. I have been trying to become plastic free and this is a very easy step. I haven't personally used the brushes yet but my family immediately used it and LOVED it. Definitely will be using this for life. My only con is that it came in a plastic bag from Amazon. I will try to recycle it but my area isn't big on recycling so I will do what I can with that.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa Herring

customer_reviews.title: MOLD
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about these brushes. My husband and I used them for about two weeks when I noticed a little mold at the bottom. I scraped it off and continued using until not long after I saw more mold. I threw them both away and thought maybe they weren’t sealed? I had ordered a 4 pack and to my shock I went to grab the other two and they were covered in mold. I sent the company a message and received no response. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: kacey Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much. It was easy to get used to (there is a teeny difference between using plastic vs wood as the wood can catch on the inside of your cheeks) and does a good job. I honestly like them more than the plastic tooth brushes I've used in the past. They're more comfortable and I think they brush better. I always keep extra in case I get an unexpected guest and they only need it for a day or so and they don't have to contribute to plastic waste :)
customer_reviews.author: shlby18

customer_reviews.title: Great product, not hard on gums, great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been transitioning to more all natural products in my life and these natural bamboo toothbrushes were an awesome find. The bristles are soft so they won't hurt your gums. I thought having a wood handle would be a little weird in my mouth (compared to the usual plastic), but it actually isn't. The brushes are numbered 1-4, so if you use them in order then you'll know when it's time to replace them! I've been really pleased with these brushes and will order more when mine run out.
customer_reviews.author: VanessaP

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love these toothbrushes. I use them everyday! I would say the bristles are medium softness. They aren't the softest but aren't rough. At first you may have a sort of "wood flavor" but it goes away after one or two brushings. The only issue I have is that they are hard to tell apart, you just have to remember your number if you have other people that are using the same bathroom, but its not too hard. Overall it works just like a toothbrush should and I am putting less plastic in the ocean by using these so it makes it a win win!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I loved the fact that these were environmentally friendly... but that's it. The bamboo was uncomfortable to hold and the bamboo around the bristles was so wide it would hurt my mouth and cheek. On most of these the bristles fell out within the first week, and brushing your teeth to end up with a mouthful of bristles is AWFUL. The only upside of the entire brush is the bristles were soft AND the brush didn't weigh much.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle

customer_reviews.title: Best toothbrush I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had bamboo toothbrushes before; they cost more than these and the brush heads were nothing special. THESE tooth brushes have a wonderful curved bristle design that really gets my teeth nice and clean. :-) The bamboo handles feel nice in my hand and each brush is numbered so if you have multiple people using the same bathroom you can easily keep things straight. SO - great product, reasonable price, and fits in with my need to use less plastic. Win, win, win. Buy these brushes - you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wellstead

customer_reviews.title: Tore the hell out of my mouth
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I am allergic to latex and silicone... so I was looking for a rubber free toothbrush... surprisingly hard to find nowadays... This bamboo brush tore the hell out of my mouth. Sorry, but just because it is "natural" does not mean that it is good. The OraMD is a MUCH better toothbrush if you need a latex free toothbrush, and that is the one I got to replace this abomination.
customer_reviews.author: Z Man

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart easily, not high quality
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to minimize our plastic usage, but I don't think this is the right brand to do it. The bristles come out of the brush while you're brushing, even with minimal use.
customer_reviews.author: sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Read the one star reviews.  That was my experience
customer_reviews.text: The bamboo tastes bad and is rough on the cheeks. The bristles are poor quality. I tried to use it long enough to use it for a while but it was really bad. I HAD TO THROUGH THEM ALL OUT. Such a waste.
customer_reviews.author: JDP3

customer_reviews.title: bamboo toothbursh
customer_reviews.text: so far it is good quality. my guests like it. Update: jan 10, 2019 The bristles do come out from time to time. Apart from that i like that it is soft but not too soft. Compared to a jcp brand I bought, I prefer these. To the supplier, please let the manufacturerer know the at least 2 bristles fall out while brushing maybe every few days and it is highly uncomfortable. Overall, I'd still buy these because I've noticed that phone the shedding has stopped.
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrushes!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I really love to have everything in natural element, and I love bamboos. I was suprised that it really helped me with my gum sensitivity, other brushes used to be tough I think on my gum I used to get blood when I brush my teeth. Not sure was this solved with just the brush or even for changing my tooth paste to "Tea tree". What ever it is, I really love this toothbrush and will order again when I run out soon. Durability is also amazing a box, could easily last you a year.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Featured these on my blog: mylow-wastegreenblog.tumblr.com Great way to live life more sustainably. I've been using these for almost 2 years now. Every 3 months I move onto the next one. They are great for everyday and get the job done. If you travel I would recommend getting a tube to put it in or reusable silicone bag. I just put foil over the head and that does the trick for me.
customer_reviews.author: mamalonghorn45

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these, but the bristles started falling out after only a week of use and after another week a whole clump of bristles fell out while I was brushing, so I was stuck spitting out little nylon strands in the sink. Horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa A Brown

customer_reviews.title: EcoFriendly
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for new toothbrushes that would be recyclable so I'm not putting more and more plastic out there in the environment. Found these and have been very happy. They are numbered 1 through 4 so you know which is yours, and the bristles are soft and feel very nice on the gums. Clean very well and leave my mouth feeling and looking great. Definitely will repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Pam E. Owston

customer_reviews.title: Awesome with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrush is fantastic, the bristles are soft, and it does the job. Good value for the amount of toothbrushes. I understand why the bristles are a non biodegradable and non recyclable material, but I wish it would be designed with a way to remove the bristles as to properly recycle to rest of the toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend these at all
customer_reviews.text: These have been AWFUL. Every time I brush my teeth I gag on the bristles that fall out in my mouth. This is my second time purchasing these tooth brushes (I exclusively use bamboo brushes) with the hope that my first order was a flop.... but nope. Do not recommend these at all.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Dbrot

customer_reviews.title: My top pick!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so super happy with these that I’ve ordered them multiple times as it’s time to replace. The bristles are softer than most bamboo toothbrushes and I LOVE the numbers so that my family can tell their brushes apart.
customer_reviews.author: lindalou

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but watch your brushing
customer_reviews.text: After extensive research, I picked these up for my wife and I. A couple of bristles cane out on the first brushing but all seems good now. We have peace of mind knowing we are trying to limit our plastic pollution contribution but I’d recommend just watching on that first brushing to ensure you don’t have bristles come out. In fact, If I could give manufacturer one piece of advice it would be to find a way to fix that problem. It’s the only reason it didn’t get 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Bristles easily fall apart
customer_reviews.text: Within two days of using this product the bristles started falling out. I thought it maybe was a fluke and kept trying the tooth brush to no avail. Unfortunately, I'm very discouraged about trying other plastic free tooth brush handles. At least since it's sustainable I don't feel too bad about throwing them all away.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: More description pls
customer_reviews.text: They are nice toothbrushes. My only complaint is that they're not made in the US which I was under the impression they were since they popped up first when I typed "toothbrushes made in USA" in the search bar. I wish this was made more apparent in the description of the product. But overall it seems to be a good product and I will likely purchase it again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Roxana

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: They do the job while keeping my peace of mind about creating less plastic waste. There is something uncomfortable about the bristles, I just can't figure it out. It seems like they are too long or the head is too skinny. I find it difficult to brush the back of my front teeth with this toothbrush. After about a week, I am getting more used to them. My husband still is not on board but is coming around to them.
customer_reviews.author: alex casebolt

customer_reviews.title: I love these toothbrushes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these toothbrushes! I was worried about how a bamboo toothbrush would feel in my mouth, but I think it's fine. The brush is durable just like a regular toothbrush, but zero guilt! A lot of times, sustainable products will still come in plastic packaging, but I love how these toothbrushes not only came in a box, but also came with four so I don't have to keep buying them constantly. This is a great alternative to plastic toothbrushes, and I will definitely be buying these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Radigan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the environment, bad for your teeth!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this because we wanted to cut back on our plastic consumption and waste. I like the idea of this but it is one terrible toothbrush. The wood base is so huge I can't even fit it between my teeth and jawbone at the back of my mouth to get a complete brushing. I don't see any reason why ecologically friendly design has to be so clunky and primitive. A real disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I'm obsessed! I have always used plastic toothbrushes, and upon learning how damaging plastic can be on our environment, I wanted a better solution. These toothbrushes are amazing! I was expecting lower quality, but they are actually much better than the plastic toothbrushes I had before. We will definitely be reordering these once we're done with the ones we are using now. I won't ever go back to using plastic with these brushes around! Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I like these toothbrushes. However, I like to cover my toothbrushes with a Steripod from floating poop particles and doing so, I’ve noticed my toothbrushes getting dark (like maybe mold but early, early, early stage, idk) but I understand it’s natural bamboo wood so it’s normal if the moisture is enclosed? It’s a great toothbrush though..
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Wood, Soft Brushes, Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would cringe at the texture of wood or that it would get rough quickly, but that hasn't been the case. The wood is smooth enough and the brushes are soft. I'm on my second box. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: hwolfbio

customer_reviews.title: Great brushes!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand, I feel much better about following my dentist and actually tossing a toothbrush every 3 months. Less plastic in life! The bristles are soft yet sturdy enough to do their job, I have not had any issues with loose or shedding bristles in my multiple purchases! Will continue to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney A

customer_reviews.title: Firmest of the "softs"
customer_reviews.text: I have sensitive teeth and have to use soft bristle brushes. However, lots of other bamboo brushes out there are way too soft, they won't clean my teeth. These ones are PERFECT. Also I think the contoured bristles help. I was so glad to find these brushes and reduce the amount of plastic revolving through my life.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and eco-friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I had tried a bamboo toothbrush from a different brand prior to this one and it was a rough experience. The bristles were way too soft and constantly falling out every time I brushed. I am glad I gave this brand a try though because my experience with this brush has been awesome! The bristles are not too soft or too hard and always stay in-tact after I brush my teeth. I also bought a tongue scraper from the same company and it has been life-altering, haha. I especially love that all of this company's packaging is plastic-free. 10/10, would recommend to anyone with teeth.
customer_reviews.author: BarbieC

customer_reviews.title: Bamboo Splits and Bristles Fall Out
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these. I purchased this product a couple of times, believing that perhaps I received a defective lot the first time. Unfortunately, the quality is inconsistent. Half the toothbrushes worked well while the other half split apart leaving me with a mouth full of bristles. One of the toothbrushes lasted only 2 days; another less than a week. Pros: Eco-friendly product, Eco-friendly packaging Cons: Inconsistent quality
customer_reviews.author: Beanz

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the wooden texture is weird.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the WowE toothbrush for a month, and it seems to work just fine, like a standard plastic toothbrush. No bristles have fallen out. I like that it's made of bamboo instead of plastic. I'm probably going to keep buying these instead of plastic toothbrushes. However, it's taken a few weeks to get used to rubbing a wooden stick around in my mouth. It's still slightly unpleasant, but significantly better than at the beginning. It's like one of those wooden spoons you get when eating individual cups of orange creamsicle ice cream. Just something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Never use plastic brushes again
customer_reviews.text: I don't use regular tooth brushes on a regular basis, as I use an electric one, but these are perfect for when I travel! Just make sure you store the spare ones in a dry spot so they don't go moldy and air dry the one you're using before storing it in the travel case. They work well, even the texture and strength of the bristles.
customer_reviews.author: gardenmagician

customer_reviews.title: After 2 months it started to smell horrible and became unusable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these toothbrushes in November 2016. There was always a brown residue left over the morning after using it, but I continued to use it as i figured it was just because of the material it was made from. After 2 months it started to smell horrible and became unusable. I used the subsequent 3 for 1 month each. I will not go back to using them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Once I finally wear this toothbrush out (it has been months and it refuses to lose its original form), I'll reorder this pack. I bought the four pack, but my girlfriend took two and gave one away, so I only got one. Such is life. Great product, earth-friendly, and long lasting. Can't go wrong here. Better lifespan than any of that plastic junk.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Unsanitary and falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, these are just not sanitary, and as a result my gums are swollen and feel infected. The bamboo retains any form of bacteria, and that continues to transfer to your mouth as you brush. The bristles fall out about two weeks after use. I use Eco Dent tooth powder, so maybe that has some sort of effect on the bamboo? But this just isn’t good at all. I have since ordered an electric toothbrush. It will still contribute to our worldwide plastic problem, but less than the regular disposable plastic toothbrushes, and much better for your mouth health than these bamboo toothbrushes.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Tuiasosopo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect zero waste toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are just what I was looking for. They are totally compostable and ship with no plastic. Our family of 4 loves the numbers so we know which one belongs to each of us.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyMedlock

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these brushes
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these brushes for well over a year and I LOVE them. They are soft but effective, and I love the feel of the light bamboo while brushing. I have never had any problem with bristles falling out. The only issue we have ever had is that my daughter's braces tore the bristles right up, so these are not good for those with braces. But other than that, they are fantastic brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Erica S

customer_reviews.title: Narrow brush, this is why they dont give use a close up view of the product
customer_reviews.text: Was not impressed with the quality, I was torn between giving 2 or 3 stars. They will work good enough I suppose, but the brush is very narrow, my squeeze of toothpaste is actually wider than the bristles of the brush. Someone apparently isnt getting a big enough Christmas bonus so they scrimp on production cost.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty neat. The soft bristles are not too soft, and do the job well. It is not bulky and works well. They hold up really well, I havnt thrown one away because it wore out yet, only because I'm not sure how long you should use a wood toothbrush and have it stay sanitary. I like them and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is gorgeous! I cannot believe the quality of the bag for the price. It is very sturdy, roomy and it will hold up with time! I ended up returning the bag because I needed more space (I carry lots around for my job) but I would buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: not sure about the quality as they loose color really quickly and thus already looked super used after only a few uses
customer_reviews.text: These are okay, not sure about the quality as they loose color really quickly and thus already looked super used after only a few uses. I'm not sure if that's supposed to happen. Also there's no tongue cleaner on the back side. But worst of all the bristles broke (in my mouth) after only one month of using the tooth brush =/.
customer_reviews.author: Margo A

customer_reviews.title: My forever toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using bamboo toothbrushes. I made the switch because I am on a mission to become greener. My first thought was that the bristles were so soft! My second thought was that they are sturdy but lightweight. My third thought while I was brushing is that the brush isn’t angled like a plastic toothbrush so the first few brushes it felt a little awkward. Overall, I love these toothbrushes and I am forever using them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Use for travel, not permanently
customer_reviews.text: I love that this reduces plastic toothbrush use, but I've been using these for about a year now and my teeth are starting to hurt. The bristles are a little too plastic-y and hard, it's hard to hold, and it doesn't hold that foaminess of the toothpaste. I'd recommend getting it for traveling if you normally use an electric toothbrush and need something to travel with, but not for permanent use.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: but these have been my favorite! I feel they last longer than other brands
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many bamboo toothbrushes, but these have been my favorite! I feel they last longer than other brands. I have not had a problem with bristles falling out like I have with other brands and the wood does not discolor or develop a smell even after a month of twice daily use. These are a wonderful eco-friendly alternative to plastic brushes and I am glad I made the change.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Howard

customer_reviews.title: At first it 's like putting a tongue suppressor in my mouth.
customer_reviews.text: The product became MOLDY. A tooth brush used a few times. Yuck
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied with the texture
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the texture of the bamboo made me unable to use this toothbrush comfortably. It's unfinished, slightly rough and feels like I am brushing my teeth with a popsicle stick. I also found that the head of the toothbrush is too bulky for my mouth with a pultruding edge around the bristles. I would have really liked this toothbrush if the texture was smooth and refined. My family uses the others in the pack and they don't have any complaints. I am going to save mine to use it for cleaning or polishing jewelry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bristles fall out, but hey no plastic!
customer_reviews.text: On my first two a set of bristles came out each time. It's a bit unpleasant when you're brushing your teeth. But after that they work fine, it's a basic toothbrush. Why are we even still making plastic toothbrushes, it makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: Graham King

customer_reviews.title: Go Green Help Save the Environment
customer_reviews.text: In an effort to go greener we decided to start using Bamboo Toothbrushes. This Brand and product will not disappoint you. Very satisfied with how they feel in your mouth and teeth. We'll re-buy this product again. It will not disappoint you. This is the first and only brand we have tried for bamboo tooth brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Vicuna-Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great spirit - 50% performance
customer_reviews.text: Two out of the four toothbrushes had their bristles come out in my mouth on first use. Terrible and potentially dangerous occurrence. The two that didn't do that worked great and did not irritate my gums or develop a smell for being made out of bamboo. Unfortunately I could not buy again because of the 50% product performance.
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppe

customer_reviews.title: I really like these brushes
customer_reviews.text: I really like these tooth brushes 1 because the handle is made from bamboo which is much better than the plastic handles that are ending up in the landfills On top of that and perhaps more important when it comes to a tooth brush-it cleans my teeth really well
customer_reviews.author: atnb

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I love that these are numbered because I share them with my family. I wanted some eco-friendly brushes after I found out that the plastic from conventional brushes doesn't get recycled. My only complaints are that the bamboo feels weird on my tongue, and the bristles are just a little too soft. Otherwise these are great!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Mixed.
customer_reviews.text: Not thrilled. Love the recycling aspect and packaging. Love the big bristles and shape. The natural bamboo, once wet with saliva, creates friction with lips and mouth causing discomfort. Maybe they could have sealed it somehow. I have rubbed coconut oil on mine, which seemed to help somewhat. Also, the natural bristles, which are designed to be removed before recycling, get caught in my teeth or just fall out while brushing. I think every brushing I've had to spit one out, or tweezer-ed it out of my teeth. At this point, I wonder how many bristles will be left after 3 months. Big design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Redmond

customer_reviews.title: NOT made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: This products appears from its description to be made in the USA, but it's "Made responsibly in China." NOT disclosed, and not what I was looking for AND NOT RETURNABLE, even in it's original packaging. Amazon should display the packaging, back and front, so consumers can view EVERYTHING. Bummer. Now I'm stuck with more Chinese-made stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Happy I found these
customer_reviews.text: Happy I found these. Obviously love the fact that they are natural. Love the fact they are numbered, in a family of 4. But they seem to grow mold quickly. In two weeks, one of the brushes turned black around the bristles. They did this the first time I purchased them, but I figured it was time to change them, even though it was only a month and half. This time, they are turning black quicker. Very disappointed. We use natural toothpaste as well, so I'm confused. Bamboo shouldn't grow mold.
customer_reviews.author: VS14168583

customer_reviews.title: Work
customer_reviews.text: The bristles are not too hard or soft and the handle is not too skinny! It's ok! I might have to change it more often, but at least I know I won't be contributing to a big pile of used toothbrushes somewhere!
customer_reviews.author: lionesspride

customer_reviews.title: Very, very glad I made this purchase
customer_reviews.text: The only toothbrush I will ever use from now on. The heads are a little bigger than normal toothbrushes, which I feel makes me pay attention to my brushing routine more because I can't comfortably close my mouth around it for too long and do other things like text, etc. They last a super long time and really make my teeth feel clean.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Very nice concept
customer_reviews.text: I like the environmental-friendly idea of this product! The product fits the description well. I took one star off because the brush is a little too hard for me. It hurts my gums a little bit. But that might be because I was using a super soft brush before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like these toothbrushes the bristles are soft it clean very ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like these toothbrushes the bristles are soft it clean very well and aregentle on the gums. I really like the idea that they are made of bamboo and when I throw them away that they will compost eventually instead of a plastic toothbrush that you toss out and it lasts forever just waiting to be discovered by an archaeologist 2000 years from now.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: I like that these are environmentally friendly and cut down on ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are environmentally friendly and cut down on plastic waste. AT first I found that the bristles were a little large and hurt my mouth but now that I am used to them I don't even notice. I am definitely never going back to plastic!
customer_reviews.author: Leese

customer_reviews.title: FAVORITE toothbrush ever
customer_reviews.text: FAVORITE toothbrush ever! These toothbrushes are not only better for the environment, but the bristles are soft and wonderful! We refuse to use any other toothbrush and highly recommend them to friends and family and whoever else is looking for a unique toothbrush that is also ecofriendly!
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Good, basic brush
customer_reviews.text: This is my first foray into toothbrushes of an unusual material. I've long liked bamboo products and figured those would be fine for a toothbrush. And indeed they are. The handle is simple and sturdy and comfortable to hold, whether the holder be my husband and I or our toddler. The brush is a little beyond basic with a nice scrubby curve and nothing particularly outrageous going on other than that--a good, basic toothbrush. These seem to be quite ecological (I plan to break them up as they wear out and toss them in the compost pile for long-term composting) and they are cute and do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Emily J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!! Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one pack for my whole family and we each have our own number. I’ll be buying a new pack every 3 months. Love everything about them. They’re soft on my teeth and gums and I love that they’re good for the environment. Makes me no longer feel guilty when I have to throw away my toothbrushes from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: These toothbrushes are really cool. I love there are 4 and I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are really cool. I love there are 4 and I don't have to worry about getting new ones for a year. The only issue I had is after some use the texture of the bamboo gets a little rough because the coating comes off. I put coconut oil on it and that helped. I'm pretty sure the texture issue is something unique to me and it really is not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: DDaniels

customer_reviews.title: Soft bristle, but firm. Strong bamboo handle.
customer_reviews.text: Just received these in the mail the other day. I've tried bamboo toothbrushes in the past, but they were awful. This toothbrush however is legit. It isn't too soft of a bristle, but not hard with. So, it gets your teeth the right clean. The bamboo handle is the perfect strength and smoothness. Doesn't appear it will fall apart or become water saturated like others I have used. Next I'm buying the charcoal infused ones. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Christine Carrington

customer_reviews.title: Love this toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product!! Another step towards getting off plastic. Took a couple brushes for my lips to get used to it BUT that’s only because I am conditioned to plastic. Now it’s my go to toothbrush. Won’t EVER buy another type of toothbrush. Gave away as gifts and have only gotten positive responses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Thought these would be so cute for visitors. Unfortunately, the bristles come off in your mouth and choke you.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Lovely to Use
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes aren't just good for the environment, they feel wonderful to use. Easy to tell who's is who's by the numbers on them. The clean bamboo makes any bathroom look more minimalist and light. These toothbrushes brushes seemed to stay cleaner for longer than plastic tooth brushes, and I feel much better about buying these over the plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Dawnwhisper

customer_reviews.title: These are great. My boy and I are all over-vigorous brushers ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My boys and I are all over-vigorous brushers which tend to cause our gums to painfully recede when we're not careful. These bamboo brushes seem to be softer than the typical soft traditional plastic brushes which helps remind us to be gentle. It's kind of like brushing with a popsicle stick but I am okay with that. It gets my teeth clean just as well as the $4 plastic brushes. I like the eco-aspect of these as well though when I am ordering these things in bulk they don't need to be individually wrapped.
customer_reviews.author: Lolly

customer_reviews.title: Buying again!
customer_reviews.text: When I used these for the first time, they felt a little odd. Just different than a store bought plastic brush. It's lighter and more gentle. If you've been using plastic brushes your whole life, it takes a little getting used to but I think you'll be a convert. I love that these brushes are bamboo, a great organic choice.
customer_reviews.author: Wendi Ballew

customer_reviews.title: This is a good tooth brush at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tooth brush at a great price. There are four per pack. The bristles are not too stiff they form perfectly around my teeth so I am not brushing my gum.. They are also the first brush I have found that do not scrape my gum. I feel good using it knowing that it's biodegradable and made of bamboo. I always apriciate when I find products that are both effective and environmentally friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, bad application.
customer_reviews.text: Too rough. It made my sensitive teeth worse. Plus it tastes like you're chewing on paper.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wronkowski

customer_reviews.title: Great Green Toothbrush! Not So Good Texture...
customer_reviews.text: I'm really excited to have a greener, more renewable toothbrush that won't just sit in a landfill forever when I'm done with it! I like how the bristles are a little on the former side. My biggest complaint is I don't like the feeling of the bamboo I'm my mouth. It gives me goosebumps just thing about it. I kind of complain it to the feeling you get when you hear nails on a chalkboard...
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these brushes. They are soft and sturdy and bristles have not fallen out either. They come packaged in just cardboard (no plastic!) which is what I prefer because it is easy to recycle. It felt a bit strange the first time I used these brushes because they are not rounded as much as your standard plastic tooth brush and the surface texture is bamboo. However, I got used to it very fast. I am so happy to have found a toothbrush that is less harmful to the environment. I will be repurchasing these brushes and I highly recommend them to everyone! These brushes should be the standard toothbrush in every home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feeling good helping the environment while gaining clean teeth
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I kept searching for eco friendly toothbrushes to come across these. They have a Great design to the bristle with a wave shape as it helps get into the nooks and crannies and their softness is comparable to non eco friendly ones I used to use. As well, the shape of the handle itself gives a very comfortable grip when brushing. These are a great value too.
customer_reviews.author: Eva but not a bot

product_meta.title: Wowe Lifestyle Natural Organic Bamboo Toothbrush Eco-Friendly Wood, Ergonomic Biodegradable Handle , Soft BPA Free Bristles, Pack of 4
feature_bullets: KEEP ALL THOSE PLASTIC toothbrushes out of the oceans and landfills. These bamboo toothbrushes are a great way to help keep the earth green.
A PACK OF 4 TOOTHBRUSHES will last one person a full year. Buy a pack of 4 toothbrushes for each person in your household.
BPA FREE BRISTLES are soft and made from high quality nylon

100% PLASTIC FREE ZERO WASTE PACKAGING. ZERO WASTE means we try to use as little packaging as possible while using all recycled material! Each pack comes with 4 individually numbered toothbrushes numbered 1-4

SMOOTH & NATURAL BAMBOO HANDLE will never splinter and is water resistant. Stronger and harder than wood, Bamboo is also more durable and healthier than any plastic. No need to dry the handle after use, just rinse your toothbrush and put back into its holder, just like you would with any other old plastic toothbrush

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
